shopping.name: Chengdu Taikoo Li Evening Stroll
shopping.notes: Evening stroll after arriving in Shanghai. Taikoo Li features international brands like Apple, ZARA, Adidas, and CROCS. Open late evening. Trendy outdoor shopping complex with modern architecture.

shopping.name: POP MART Global Flagship Store
shopping.location: 南京东路299号宏伊国际广场F1层, Shanghai (Nanjing Road)
shopping.notes: Global flagship store for Pop Mart. Features latest blind box collections, exclusive designs, and immersive brand experience. Near your hotel at Nanjing Road. Open 10am-10pm.

shopping.name: Anfu Road Boutique Area
shopping.location: 安福路, Xuhui District, Shanghai (near Changshu Road Metro)
shopping.notes: Trendy street famous for niche boutiques and indie stores. Features brands like Brandy Melville (安福路308号) and various designer boutiques. Best visited afternoon/evening. Great for INFJ-friendly, low-key shopping.

shopping.name: Wukang Road Shopping
shopping.notes: Historic street with indie fashion stores like LOOKNOW (武康路286号). Mix of boutique shops, cafes, and cultural sites. Connected to Anfu Road - easy to visit both. Open 10am-8pm.

shopping.name: Tianzifang Art District
shopping.location: 泰康路210号, Shanghai (Dapuqiao Metro Exit 1)
shopping.notes: Art district with small boutiques, craft shops, and galleries in traditional Shikumen buildings. Good for unique souvenirs, local crafts, and creative gifts. Open 10am-10pm.

shopping.name: Nanluoguxiang Shopping Street
shopping.location: 南锣鼓巷, Dongcheng District, Beijing (Nanluoguxiang Metro Exit E)
shopping.notes: Historic hutong with small shops selling crafts, souvenirs, and local snacks. Can visit after Forbidden City. Mix of tourist items and cute boutiques. Open 9am-9pm. Note: Can be crowded on weekends.

shopping.name: Sanlitun Taikoo Li
shopping.location: 三里屯路11、19号院, Chaoyang District, Beijing (Tuanjiehu Metro Exit D, 240m walk)
shopping.notes: Modern shopping complex with international fashion brands, Apple Store (三里屯路19号院7号楼), and trendy boutiques. North and South districts. Open 10am-10pm. Best area in Beijing for fashion shopping.

shopping.name: TOPTOY Toy Collectibles
shopping.location: Multiple locations: Western District Mall (西单大悦城B1-30), Chaoyang Joy City (朝阳合生汇LG), or Wukesong (五棵松华熙LIVE)
shopping.notes: Chinese toy collectible brand similar to Pop Mart. Features Chinese designer toys, blind boxes, and figures. Choose location nearest to other activities. Open 10am-10pm.

shopping.name: Page One Bookstore (Beijing Fang)
shopping.location: 前门廊房头条21号院北京坊L2层, Beijing
shopping.notes: International bookstore chain with English book section. Modern design, good selection of art, design, and travel books. Cafe inside. Open 10am-10pm.

shopping.name: Tsutaya Bookstore
shopping.location: 朝阳门外大街10号THE BOX朝外年轻力中心, Beijing
shopping.notes: Japanese bookstore chain with curated English books section. Stylish interior, stationery, and lifestyle products. Open 10am-10pm.

shopping.name: Sanlitun Sanlian Bookstore
shopping.location: 北三里屯南43号楼底商, Beijing (near Sanlitun)
shopping.notes: 24-hour independent bookstore. Some English books, strong Chinese literature section. Quiet atmosphere, good for browsing. Open 24 hours.

shopping.name: Cute Boutiques Exploration
shopping.notes: Explore small boutique shops around Sanlitun area. Look for designer stores, cute accessory shops, and independent brands. Many hidden in side streets and hutongs near the main shopping area.

notes: Shopping is scheduled for specific days to avoid fatigue. Day 7 (Shanghai) focuses on niche boutiques and toy collectibles as requested. Days 15-16 (Beijing) cover fashion shopping and indie bookstores with English sections. Costs are estimated budget allocations in USD, not fixed prices. Most shops accept WeChat Pay and Alipay; cash less common. Anfu Road and Wukang Road in Shanghai are walkable and can be visited together. Sanlitun in Beijing is the best area for fashion and has nearby bookstores. Pop Mart and similar toy stores are located in malls throughout both cities. All bookstores mentioned have some English book sections, though selection varies. Shopping areas are integrated near other activities to minimize travel time. Note: Avoid shopping during lunch hours (12-2pm) as some smaller boutiques may close. Weekend crowds can be heavy at Nanluoguxiang and Sanlitun.
